description.narrative: 6.3. Civil society organisations, the media, young people, children and other actors are engaged in alliances for child rights and social inclusion, which contributes to Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Disadvantaged children increasingly benefit from an improved policy environment and systems guided by quality research and data.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.3. Civil society organisations, the media, young people, children and other actors are engaged in alliances for child rights and social inclusion

description.narrative: Since 2015, UNICEF raised the awareness of the diplomatic community and media on the needs and unfulfilled rights of children living in the State of Palestine, in the Gaza Strip and Area C of the West Bank, and supported behavior change campaigns. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2017

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Partnership/collaboration for policy advocacy for children is established with civic society, NGOs/CSOs, private sector or Parliament Committees

target.value: 2017:Advocacy in partnership with UN organizations and I/NGOs.

actual.value: 2017:On track Advocacy was led in support of children's rights, with a focus on the Gaza Strip (WASH and electricity crisis) and the West Bank (lack of access to safe drinking water in Area C; children with disabilities; education-related violations).
